item.title: Combine data frames with new column
item.description: Answer originally provided by Jack Penzer & Jamie Hudson, Data Scientists The Problem Sometimes we have multiple data frames containing the same variables but for different companies, for example. We might then want to be able to join these data frames together, creating a new variable (column) that corresponds to the name of the original data frame. In this example, we are going to use three dummy data frames called amazon, microsoft, and google, which contain the columns message_id, message, and author- though the solutions provided would work even if the data frames had many more columns.
